channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bitcoin scores all-time high, blowing past $118,000 with room to run
item.description: A soft U.S. dollar and the digital currency friendliness of the Trump administration is helping things along.

item.title: Trump is ‘extremely troubled’ by Fed’s approach according to new letter, but bank official stands firm on independence
item.description: In a response to Fortune, Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem defended the Fed's autonomy, citing global evidence that indepen...

item.title: Does Brooklyn Need a New Waterfront Neighborhood?
item.description: The risks and opportunities of turning 122 industrial acres over to developers.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg is determined to build an AI superteam—and he’s poaching from Sam Altman with multimillion-dollar pay packages
item.description: Reports of $200 million and $300 million compensation packages are rattling the Valley.

item.title: Livvy Dunne Tried to Buy Babe Ruth’s Former Apartment. An N.Y.C. Co-op Board Said ‘No’.
item.description: The influencer and former collegiate gymnast tried to buy the Manhattan two-bedroom, but instead joined the ranks of high-profile rejects like Madonna...

item.title: Indeed and Glassdoor are cutting over 1,000 jobs. The CEO overseeing both companies says ‘we must adapt’ to AI
item.description: Glassdoor CEO Christian Sutherland-Wong is also out.

item.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
item.description: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will d...

item.title: Musk’s Chatbot Started Spouting Nazi Propaganda. That’s Not the Scariest Part.
item.description: The folks at X say don’t worry, they’re on it.

item.title: Inside Gaza’s world of ‘cash brokers’ as currency disappears: ‘We lose nearly half of our money just to be able to spend it’
item.description: Sugar costs $80-$100 per kilogram (2.2 pounds), multiple people said; before the war, that cost less than $2.

item.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
item.description: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will d...

item.title: Srebrenica, a Massacre Foretold, Still Casts Its Shadow
item.description: The town was supposed to be a “safe area,” protected by U.N. peacekeepers, but Serb forces massacred 8,000 Muslim men and boys there.

item.title: Srebrenica, a Massacre Foretold, Still Casts Its Shadow
item.description: The town was supposed to be a “safe area,” protected by U.N. peacekeepers, but Serb forces massacred 8,000 Muslim men and boys there.

item.title: Strava Fitness App Revealed Locations of Swedish Leaders
item.description: Secret meetings and private holidays of the royal family and prime minister were inadvertently made public on Strava, which has raised security concer...

item.title: Manitoba Declares Second Wildfire Emergency in a Near-Record Year
item.description: The amount of land burned this year is on pace to be the most since 1994, as 100 blazes roared on Friday across the central Canadian province.

item.title: Republicans Blame Canada for Wildfire Smoke ‘Suffocating’ the U.S.
item.description: Six members of Congress from Wisconsin and Minnesota have asked Canada to say how it plans to tackle the blazes and reduce the haze billowing south.
